RN   [6]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.8 ANGSTROMS) OF 29-182.
RX   MEDLINE=98265974; PubMed=9604938; DOI=10.1016/S0092-8674(00)81192-7;
RA   Roberts D.L., Weix D.J., Dahms N.M., Kim J.-J.P.;
RT   "Molecular basis of lysosomal enzyme recognition: three-dimensional
RT   structure of the cation-dependent mannose 6-phosphate receptor.";
RL   Cell 93:639-648(1998).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transport of phosphorylated lysosomal enzymes from the
CC       Golgi complex and the cell surface to lysosomes. Lysosomal enzymes
CC       bearing phosphomannosyl residues bind specifically to mannose-6-
CC       phosphate receptors in the Golgi apparatus and the resulting
CC       receptor-ligand complex is transported to an acidic prelyosomal
CC       compartment where the low pH mediates the dissociation of the
CC       complex.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with GGA1, GGA2 and GGA3 (By
CC       similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Lysosome membrane; Single-pass type I
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The extracellular domain is homologous to the repeating
CC       units (of approximately 147 AA) of the cation-independent mannose
CC       6-phosphate receptor.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: This receptor has optimal binding in the presence
CC       of divalent cations.

RP   CHARACTERIZATION, AND PHYSIOLOGICAL ROLE.
RC   STRAIN=K12 / MJF379;
RX   MEDLINE=99219852; PubMed=10202137; DOI=10.1093/emboj/18.7.1730;
RA   Levina N., Toetemeyer S., Stokes N.R., Louis P., Jones M.A.,
RA   Booth I.R.;
RT   "Protection of Escherichia coli cells against extreme turgor by
RT   activation of MscS and MscL mechanosensitive channels: identification
RT   of genes required for MscS activity.";
RL   EMBO J. 18:1730-1737(1999).
RN   [9]
RP   TOPOLOGY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   STRAIN=K12 / MG1655 / ATCC 47076;
RX   PubMed=15919996; DOI=10.1126/science.1109730;
RA   Daley D.O., Rapp M., Granseth E., Melen K., Drew D., von Heijne G.;
RT   "Global topology analysis of the Escherichia coli inner membrane
RT   proteome.";
RL   Science 308:1321-1323(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mechanosensitive channel that opens in response to
CC       stretch forces in the membrane lipid bilayer. Participates in the
CC       regulation of osmotic pressure changes within the cell. Forms a
CC       nonselective ion channel of 2.5 nanosiemens conductance. Opens at
CC       a pressure just below that which would cause cell disruption and
CC       death.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homopentamer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the mscL family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Chaperone that facilitates the production and
CC       integration of integral membrane proteins into the bacterial lipid
CC       bilayer.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC       Note=Folds autonomously into the membrane, bypassing the cellular
CC       translocon machinery.
CC   -!- BIOTECHNOLOGY: As a fusion partner, can be used for high-level
CC       production of other membrane proteins in their native
CC       conformations, including many eukaryotic proteins that have
CC       previously been intractable to bacterial expression.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in transporting tryptophan across the
CC       cytoplasmic membrane.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By phenylalanine under the control of regulatory
CC       protein tyrR.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the amino acid/polyamine transporter 2
CC       family. Mtr/tnaB/tyrP permease subfamily.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: This is the major myelin protein from the central
CC       nervous system. It plays an important role in the formation or
CC       maintenance of the multilamellar structure of myelin.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P60201-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=DM-20;
CC         IsoId=P60201-2; Sequence=VSP_003325;
CC   -!- DISEASE: Defects in PLP1 are the cause of leukodystrophy
CC       hypomyelinating type 1 (HLD1) [MIM:312080]; also known as
CC       Pelizaeus-Merzbacher disease. HLD1 is an X-linked recessive
CC       dysmyelinating disorder of the central nervous system in which
CC       myelin is not formed properly. It is characterized clinically by
CC       nystagmus, spastic quadriplegia, ataxia, and developmental delay.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Defects in PLP1 are the cause of spastic paraplegia X-
CC       linked type 2 (SPG2) [MIM:312920]. SPG2 is characterized by
CC       spastic gait and hyperreflexia. In some patients, complicating
CC       features include nystagmus, dysarthria, sensory disturbance,
CC       mental retardation, optic atrophy.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the myelin proteolipid protein family.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=GeneReviews;
CC       URL="http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sites/GeneTests/lab/gene/PLP1";

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

ID   NSP4_ROTBN              Reviewed;         175 AA.
AC   P08434;
DT   01-AUG-1988, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   01-AUG-1988, sequence version 1.
DT   02-MAR-2010, entry version 67.
DE   RecName: Full=Non-structural glycoprotein 4;
DE            Short=NSP4;
DE   AltName: Full=NCVP5;
DE   AltName: Full=NS28;
OS   Rotavirus A (strain Cow/United States/NCDV-Lincoln/1969
OS   G6-P6[1]-I2-R2-C2-M2-Ax-N2-T6-E2-Hx) (RV-A) (Rotavirus A (strain
OS   Nebraska calf diarrhea virus)).
OC   Viruses; dsRNA viruses; Reoviridae; Sedoreovirinae; Rotavirus;
OC   Rotavirus A.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=36439;
OH   NCBI_TaxID=9913; Bos taurus (Bovine).
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC RNA].
RX   MEDLINE=88124266; PubMed=2829135; DOI=10.1093/nar/16.2.763;
RA   Powell K.F.H., Gunn P.R., Bellamy A.R.;
RT   "Nucleotide sequence of bovine rotavirus genomic segment 10: an RNA
RT   encoding the viral nonstructural glycoprotein.";
RL   Nucleic Acids Res. 16:763-763(1988).
RN   [2]
RP   TOPOLOGY, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, GLYCOSYLATION AT ASN-8 AND ASN-18, AND
RP   CARBOHYDRATE STRUCTURE.
RX   MEDLINE=89356642; PubMed=2548854;
RA   Bergmann C.C., Maass D., Poruchynsky M.S., Atkinson P.H.,
RA   Bellamy A.R.;
RT   "Topology of the non-structural rotavirus receptor glycoprotein NS28
RT   in the rough endoplasmic reticulum.";
RL   EMBO J. 8:1695-1703(1989).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in virus morphogenesis. Functions as a receptor
CC       for the immature double-layered inner capsid particle (ICP) which
CC       transiently buds into the lumen of the rough endoplasmic reticulum
CC       during viral maturation.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Enterotoxin that causes a phospholipase C-dependent
CC       elevation of the intracellular calcium concentration in host
CC       intestinal mucosa cells. Increased concentration of intracellular
CC       calcium disrupts the cytoskeleton and the tight junctions, raising
CC       the paracellular permeability. Potentiates chloride ion secretion
CC       through a calcium ion-dependent signaling pathway, inducing age-
CC       dependent diarrhea. To perform this enterotoxigenic role in vivo,
CC       NSP4 is probably released from infected enterocytes in a soluble
CC       form capable of diffusing within the intestinal lumen and
CC       interacting with the plasma membrane receptors on neighboring
CC       epithelial cells. Possible receptors for NSP4 are alpha-1/beta-1
CC       and alpha-2/beta-1 integrin heterodimers (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer. Forms a complex with the ICP. Interacts,
CC       via the active enterotoxic peptide region, with host CAV1, early
CC       and late in infection. Interacts with host integrin ITGA1/ITGB1
CC       heterodimer. Interacts with host integrin ITGA2/ITGB1 heterodimer.
CC       Interaction with microtubules blocks trafficking to the Golgi
CC       apparatus (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Non-structural glycoprotein 4: Host rough
CC       endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Single-pass type III membrane
CC       protein. Host membrane, host caveola; Single-pass type III
CC       membrane protein (By similarity). Secreted (By similarity).
CC       Note=Immature double-layered particles assembled in the cytoplasm
CC       bud across the membrane of the endoplasmic reticulum, acquiring
CC       during this process a transient lipid membrane that is modified
CC       with the ER resident viral glycoproteins NSP4 and VP7; these
CC       enveloped particles also contain VP4. As the particles move
CC       towards the interior of the ER cisternae, the transient lipid
CC       membrane and the non-structural protein NSP4 are lost, while the
CC       virus surface proteins VP4 and VP7 rearrange to form the outermost
CC       virus protein layer, yielding mature infectious triple-layered
CC       particles. NSP4 also localizes in vesicular structures, which
CC       contain an autophagosomal marker and associate with viroplasms in
CC       virus-infected cells (By similarity).
CC   -!- DOMAIN: A disordered 28 aa C-terminal domain is presented to the
CC       cytoplasm by each subunit of the tetrameric receptor.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The coiled coil region mediates oligomerization (By
CC       similarity).
CC   -!- PTM: Mannosylated.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Binds 1 calcium ion per tetramer. The calcium ion
CC       is bound by a glutamine from each tetrameric partner and by a
CC       glutamic acid from two of the tetrameric partners, while the
CC       glutamic acid from the other two partners do not participate in
CC       binding the ion (By similarity).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the rotavirus NSP4 family.
CC   -!- CAUTION: A candidate enterotoxigenic cleaved form of the protein
CC       has been suggested, but it remains unclear whether this truncated
CC       form constitutes an active enterotoxin in vivo.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RC   STRAIN=ATCC 33303 / B10;
RX   PubMed=9632256; DOI=10.1046/j.1365-2958.1998.00814.x;
RA   Dupuis A., Darrouzet E., Duborjal H., Pierrard B., Chevallet M.,
RA   van Belzen R., Albracht S.P.J., Lunardi J.;

RN   [4]
RP   TOPOLOGY, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RC   STRAIN=ATCC 11166 / DSM 1710 / IFO 16435 / LMG 2962 / NCIB 8254;
RX   PubMed=11245799; DOI=10.1016/S0005-2728(00)00265-6;
RA   Roth R., Haegerhaell C.;
RT   "Transmembrane orientation and topology of the NADH:quinone
RT   oxidoreductase putative quinone binding subunit NuoH.";
RL   Biochim. Biophys. Acta 1504:352-362(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: NDH-1 shuttles electrons from NADH, via FMN and iron-
CC       sulfur (Fe-S) centers, to quinones in the respiratory chain. The
CC       immediate electron acceptor for the enzyme in this species is
CC       believed to be ubiquinone. Couples the redox reaction to proton
CC       translocation (for every two electrons transferred, four hydrogen
CC       ions are translocated across the cytoplasmic membrane), and thus
CC       conserves the redox energy in a proton gradient. This subunit may
CC       bind ubiquinone.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: NADH + quinone = NAD(+) + quinol.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: NDH-1 is composed of 14 different subunits. Subunits
CC       nuoA, H, J, K, L, M, N constitute the membrane sector of the
CC       complex (Probable).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular chromatophore membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No functional NADH-quinone oxidoreductase
CC       complex. Cells lacking this gene have a nearly normal respiratory
CC       growth phenotype on lactate, however they are unable to perform
CC       anaerobic photosynthesis. It is suggested that in R.capsulatus
CC       this complex may function in reverse flow under physiological
CC       conditions.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the complex I subunit 1 family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RN   [13]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.16 ANGSTROMS) OF 58-804 IN COMPLEX WITH
RP   MOENOMYCIN, PARTIAL PROTEIN SEQUENCE, INTERACTION WITH MLTA; UVRA;
RP   FTSL AND FTSN, MEMBRANE TOPOLOGY, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY, AND DOMAIN.
RX   PubMed=19458048; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0904030106;
RA   Sung M.-T., Lai Y.-T., Huang C.-Y., Chou L.-Y., Shih H.-W.,
RA   Cheng W.-C., Wong C.-H., Ma C.;
RT   "Crystal structure of the membrane-bound bifunctional transglycosylase
RT   PBP1b from Escherichia coli.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 106:8824-8829(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cell wall formation. Synthesis of cross-linked
CC       peptidoglycan from the lipid intermediates. The enzyme has a
CC       penicillin-insensitive transglycosylase N-terminal domain
CC       (formation of linear glycan strands) and a penicillin-sensitive
CC       transpeptidase C-terminal domain (cross-linking of the peptide
CC       subunits).
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: (GlcNAc-(1->4)-Mur2Ac(oyl-L-Ala-gamma-D-Glu-L-
CC       Lys-D-Ala-D-Ala))(n)-diphosphoundecaprenol + GlcNAc-(1->4)-
CC       Mur2Ac(oyl-L-Ala-gamma-D-Glu-L-Lys-D-Ala-D-Ala)-
CC       diphosphoundecaprenol = (GlcNAc-(1->4)-Mur2Ac(oyl-L-Ala-gamma-D-
CC       Glu-L-Lys-D-Ala-D-Ala))(n+1)-diphosphoundecaprenol + undecaprenyl
CC       diphosphate.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Cell wall biogenesis; peptidoglycan biosynthesis.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms a trimeric complex with mipA and mltA. Has also
CC       been shown to exist as monomer or homodimer; homodimer of Alpha
CC       and Gamma isozymes can be found. Interacts with uvrA, ftsL and
CC       ftsN.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Single-pass type II
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=Alpha; Synonyms=Long;
CC         IsoId=P02919-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Gamma; Synonyms=Short;
CC         IsoId=P02919-2; Sequence=VSP_018737;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The uvrB domain 2 homolog region (UB2H domain) is
CC       important for interaction with mltA.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: A third isozyme, Beta, lacking the first 25 N-
CC       terminal amino acids of the isoform Alpha and a fourth isozyme,
CC       Delta, have been found, but seem to result from the artifactual
CC       degradation of the isoform Alpha and isoform Gamma respectively.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: In the N-terminal section; belongs to the
CC       glycosyltransferase 51 family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: In the C-terminal section; belongs to the
CC       transpeptidase family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Permease that is involved in the transport across the
CC       cytoplasmic membrane of phenylalanine.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the amino acid-polyamine-organocation (APC)
CC       superfamily. Amino acid transporter (AAT) (TC 2.A.3.1) family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Member of the two-component regulatory system phoR/phoB
CC       involved in the phosphate regulon genes expression. PhoR may
CC       function as a membrane-associated protein kinase that
CC       phosphorylates phoB in response to environmental signals.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + protein L-histidine = ADP + protein N-
CC       phospho-L-histidine.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P25888:rhlE; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-560857, EBI-548114;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 histidine kinase domain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PAS (PER-ARNT-SIM) domain.

RT   "Topology of the Neurospora plasma membrane H(+)-ATPase. Localization
RT   of a transmembrane segment.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 269:3887-3890(1994).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The plasma membrane ATPase of plants and fungi is a
CC       hydrogen ion pump. The proton gradient it generates drives the
CC       active transport of nutrients by H(+)-symport. The resulting
CC       external acidification and/or internal alkinization may mediate
CC       growth responses.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O + H(+)(In) = ADP + phosphate +
CC       H(+)(Out).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the cation transport ATPase (P-type)
CC       family. Type IIIA subfamily.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Functions as a component of the nuclear pore complex
CC       (NPC). NPC components, collectively referred to as nucleoporins
CC       (NUPs), can play the role of both NPC structural components and of
CC       docking or interaction partners for transiently associated nuclear
CC       transport factors. POM152 is important for the de novo assembly of
CC       NPCs.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The nuclear pore complex (NPC) constitutes the exclusive
CC       means of nucleocytoplasmic transport. NPCs allow the passive
CC       diffusion of ions and small molecules and the active, nuclear
CC       transport receptor-mediated bidirectional transport of
CC       macromolecules such as proteins, RNAs, ribonucleoparticles (RNPs),
CC       and ribosomal subunits across the nuclear envelope. The 55-60 MDa
CC       NPC is composed of at least 31 different subunits: ASM4, CDC31,
CC       GLE1, GLE2, NDC1, NIC96, NSP1, NUP1, NUP2, NUP100, NUP116, NUP120,
CC       NUP133, NUP145, NUP157, NUP159, NUP170, NUP188, NUP192, NUP42,
CC       NUP49, NUP53, NUP57, NUP60, NUP82, NUP84, NUP85, POM152, POM34,
CC       SEH1 and SEC1. Due to its 8-fold rotational symmetry, all subunits
CC       are present with 8 copies or multiples thereof. Interacts with
CC       NUP188.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P02994:TEF1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-12739, EBI-6314;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nuclear pore complex. Nucleus
CC       membrane; Single-pass type II membrane protein. Note=Central core
CC       structure of the nuclear pore complex.
CC   -!- PTM: The N-terminus is blocked.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated by CDC28.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 3410 molecules/cell in log phase SD
CC       medium.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Nucleoporin essential for nuclear pore assembly and
CC       fusion, nuclear pore spacing, as well as structural integrity (By
CC       similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms dimers and possibly higher-order oligomers.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nuclear pore complex. Nucleus
CC       membrane; Single-pass type I membrane protein. Endoplasmic
CC       reticulum membrane; Single-pass type I membrane protein.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated, but not all potential glycosylation sites may
CC       be used. Contains high-mannose type oligosaccharides.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated at Ser-1880 in mitosis specifically; not
CC       phosphorylated in interphase.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the NUP210 family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Picornain 3C-like protease is a thiol protease that
CC       cleaves at Gln-|-Gly or Gln-|-Ser sites in the P1 and P2
CC       polyproteins.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The VPg-NTB polyprotein may act as a membrane-anchor for
CC       the replication complex.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Nucleoside triphosphate + RNA(n) = diphosphate
CC       + RNA(n+1).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Viral genome-linked protein: Host
CC       endoplasmic reticulum lumen (Probable).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Putative ATP-dependent helicase: Host
CC       endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Single-pass membrane protein.
CC       Note=The NTB-VPg polyprotein is associated with endoplasmic-
CC       derived membranes that are active in viral replication.
CC   -!- PTM: Specific enzymatic cleavages by picornain 3C-like protease in
CC       vivo yield mature proteins. Picornain 3C-like protease is
CC       autocatalytically processed. NTB exists as NTB-VPg polyprotein as
CC       well as NTB mature protein.
CC   -!- PTM: VPg is uridylylated by the polymerase and is covalently
CC       linked to the 5'-end of genomic RNA. This uridylylated form acts
CC       as a nucleotide-peptide primer for the polymerase (By similarity).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nepoviruses RNA1 polyprotein family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 peptidase C3 domain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RdRp catalytic domain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SF3 helicase domain.
CC   -!- CAUTION: It is uncertain whether Met-1 or Met-122 is the
CC       initiator.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RA   Kouwijzer M.L.C.E., Robillard G.T., Dijkstra B.W.;
RT   "The structure of the Escherichia coli phosphotransferase IIAmannitol
RT   reveals a novel fold with two conformations of the active site.";
RL   Structure 6:377-388(1998).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent sugar
CC       phosphotransferase system (sugar PTS), a major carbohydrate active
CC       -transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar
CC       substrates concomitantly with their translocation across the cell
CC       membrane. This system is involved in mannitol transport.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Protein EIIA N(pi)-phospho-L-histidine +
CC       protein EIIB = protein EIIA + protein EIIB N(pi)-phospho-L-
CC       histidine/cysteine.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Protein EIIB N(pi)-phospho-L-
CC       histidine/cysteine + sugar = protein EIIB + sugar phosphate.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P0A6F5:groL; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-547239, EBI-543750;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIC domain forms the PTS system translocation channel
CC       and contains the specific substrate-binding site.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIB domain is phosphorylated by phospho-EIIA on a
CC       cysteinyl or histidyl residue, depending on the transported sugar.
CC       Then, it transfers the phosphoryl group to the sugar substrate
CC       concomitantly with the sugar uptake processed by the EIIC domain.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIIA domain is phosphorylated by phospho-HPr on a
CC       histidyl residue. Then, it transfers the phosphoryl group to the
CC       EIIB domain.
CC   -!- PTM: An intramolecular phosphotransfer takes places between His-
CC       554 and Cys-384.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PTS EIIA type-2 domain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PTS EIIB type-2 domain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PTS EIIC type-2 domain.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC       -transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent sugar
CC       phosphotransferase system (PTS), a major carbohydrate active
CC       -transport system, catalyzes the phosphorylation of incoming sugar
CC       substrates concomitant with their translocation across the cell
CC       membrane. This system is involved in mannose transport.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Single-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The EIID domain, with its homologous EIIC domain, forms
CC       the PTS system translocation channel and contains part of its
CC       specific substrate-binding site.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PTS EIID domain.

RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.4 ANGSTROMS) OF 37-179, AND NMR.
RC   STRAIN=168 / BGSC1A1;
RX   PubMed=16537372; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0600552103;
RA   Colbert C.L., Wu Q., Erbel P.J.A., Gardner K.H., Deisenhofer J.;
RT   "Mechanism of substrate specificity in Bacillus subtilis ResA, a
RT   thioredoxin-like protein involved in cytochrome c maturation.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 103:4410-4415(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Thiol-disulfide oxidoreductase which is required in
CC       disulfide reduction during c-type cytochrome synthesis. May accept
CC       reducing equivalents from ccdA, leading to breakage of disulfide
CC       bonds in apocytochrome c; following this reduction heme can be
CC       covalently attached. Does not play a role in sporulation.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; cytochrome c assembly.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Single-pass type II membrane
CC       protein. Note=The thioredoxin-like motif is exposed on the outside
CC       of the membrane.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the thioredoxin family. ResA subfamily.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 thioredoxin domain.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAA67494.1; Type=Frameshift; Positions=39;

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Uptake of L-rhamnose across the boundary membrane with
CC       the concomitant transport of protons into the cell (symport
CC       system). Can also transport L-mannose and L-xylose, but at reduced

CC       protein.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced by L-rhamnose via the rhaR-rhaS regulatory
CC       cascade. Also induced by L-mannose or L-xylose.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the L-rhamnose transporter (TC 2.A.7.6)
CC       family.

RN   [13]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-583, AND MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY.
RX   PubMed=19413330; DOI=10.1021/ac9004309;
RA   Gauci S., Helbig A.O., Slijper M., Krijgsveld J., Heck A.J.,
RA   Mohammed S.;
RT   "Lys-N and trypsin cover complementary parts of the phosphoproteome in
RT   a refined SCX-based approach.";
RL   Anal. Chem. 81:4493-4501(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transporter for the intake of folate. Uptake of folate
CC       in human placental choriocarcinoma cells occurs by a novel
CC       mechanism called potocytosis which functionally couples three
CC       components, namely the folate receptor, the folate transporter,
CC       and a V-type H(+)-pump.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Placenta, liver, and to a much smaller extent,
CC       in lung.
CC   -!- PTM: Heavily glycosylated.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the reduced folate carrier (RFC)
CC       transporter (TC 2.A.48) family.

RN   [12]
RP   TOPOLOGY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=16847258; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0604075103;
RA   Kim H., Melen K., Oesterberg M., von Heijne G.;
RT   "A global topology map of the Saccharomyces cerevisiae membrane
RT   proteome.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 103:11142-11147(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Part of the Sec61 complex, which is the major component
CC       of a channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein
CC       translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). The
CC       functional states of the translocon complex include co- and post-
CC       translational ER import, cotranslational membrane protein
CC       integration and retrograde transport of misfolded proteins out of
CC       the ER. In the cotranslational pathway, ribosomes synthesizing
CC       presecretory proteins are targeted to the translocon by the
CC       cytosolic signal recognition particle (SRP) and its ER-localized
CC       receptor. The association of the Sec61 complex with the ribosome
CC       is mediated by the 28S rRNA of the large ribosomal subunit. SRP-
CC       independent post-translational translocation requires the
CC       association of additional factors, such as the Sec62/63 complex
CC       and KAR2. In an initial step, the signal sequence seems to bind
CC       simultaneously to SEC61 and SEC62. A cycle of assembly and
CC       disassembly of Sec62/63 complex from SEC61 may govern the activity
CC       of the translocon. SEC61 mediates the association with the
CC       ribosome.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the heterotrimeric Sec61 complex, which is
CC       composed of SEC61, SBH1 and SSS1. Presumably three to four Sec61
CC       heterotrimers assemble into an oligomeric ring with a central
CC       aeqeous pore. In cotranslational ER import, the pore diameter
CC       varies from 9-15 A in a ribosome-free resting state to 40-60 A in
CC       a functional state when associated with the ribosome. The Sec61
CC       complex is part of a channel-forming translocon complex whose
CC       composition seem to change dependent upon different functional
CC       states. During post-translational ER import the Sec61 complex
CC       associates with the Sec62/63 complex to form the Sec complex.
CC       SEC61 interacts with STT3, OST1, OST2, OST4, SWP1 AND WBP1
CC       components of the OT complex.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P25376:AGP1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-2357;
CC       P08456:CHO1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-14055;
CC       P54837:ERV25; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-6642;
CC       P53337:ERV29; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-23662;
CC       P41543:OST1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-12651;
CC       P46964:OST2; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-12673;
CC       Q99380:OST4; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-12689;
CC       P40975:PMP2; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-2043041;
CC       P87284:PMP3; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-13555;
CC       P62990:RPS27A (xeno); NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-413053;
CC       P32368:SAC1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-16210;
CC       P21825:SEC62; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-16632;
CC       P14906:SEC63; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-16636;
CC       P39986:SPF1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-3128;
CC       P39007:STT3; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-18447;
CC       Q02795:SWP1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-12666;
CC       P33767:WBP1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-12658;
CC       P40006:YEL001C; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-2050819;
CC       Q3E7B0:YER053C-A; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16400, EBI-2047907;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 24800 molecules/cell in log phase SD
CC       medium.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the secY/SEC61-alpha family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Essential for protein export.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Part of the prokaryotic protein translocation apparatus
CC       which comprise secA, secB, secD, secE, secF, secG and secY. The
CC       translocation channel seems to be composed of a secA homodimer and
CC       four copies of a secYEG complex.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the secE/SEC61-gamma family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in protein export. Interacts with secA and secE
CC       to allow the translocation of proteins across the plasma membrane,
CC       by forming part of a channel.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: One of seven secretory proteins (secA-F and secY) that
CC       comprise the prokaryotic protein translocation apparatus.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P10408:secA; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-761422, EBI-543213;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the secY/SEC61-alpha family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: STE6 is required in yeast MATA cells for production of
CC       A-factor pheromone. STE6 is involved in the transport of the
CC       farnesyl-derivation of the A-factor pheromone.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O + alpha-factor(In) = ADP +
CC       phosphate + alpha-factor(Out).
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P62990:RPS27A (xeno); NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-18383, EBI-413053;
CC       P40318:SSM4; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-18383, EBI-18208;
CC       P61864:UBI1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-18383, EBI-19797;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- PTM: Degraded via the ubiquitin system.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ABC transporter superfamily. Alpha-
CC       factor sex pheromone exporter (TC 3.A.1.206) family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 ABC transmembrane type-1 domains.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 ABC transporter domains.

RL   J. Biol. Chem. 276:27535-27540(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Interacts with outer membrane receptor proteins that
CC       carry out high-affinity binding and energy dependent uptake into
CC       the periplasmic space of specific substrates such as cobalamin,
CC       and various iron compounds (such as iron dicitrate, enterochelin,
CC       aerobactin, etc.). In the absence of tonB these receptors bind
CC       their substrates but do not carry out active transport. TonB also
CC       interacts with some colicins and is involved in the energy-
CC       dependent, irreversible steps of bacteriophages phi 80 and T1
CC       infection. It could act to transduce energy from the cytoplasmic
CC       membrane to specific energy-requiring processes in the outer
CC       membrane, resulting in the release into the periplasm of ligands
CC       bound by these outer membrane proteins.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Forms a complex with the accessory proteins
CC       exbB and exbD.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Single-pass membrane
CC       protein; Periplasmic side.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the tonB family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: TraD is a cell envelope protein. The function of traD is

RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.83 ANGSTROMS) OF 104-230.
RX   MEDLINE=98104089; PubMed=9438861; DOI=10.1016/S0969-2126(97)00309-2;
RA   Carrell C.J., Zhang H., Cramer W.A., Smith J.L.;
RT   "Biological identity and diversity in photosynthesis and respiration:
RT   structure of the lumen-side domain of the chloroplast Rieske
RT   protein.";
RL   Structure 5:1613-1625(1997).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the cytochrome b6-f complex, which mediates
CC       electron transfer between photosystem II (PSII) and photosystem I
CC       (PSI), cyclic electron flow around PSI, and state transitions (By
CC       similarity).
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Plastoquinol-1 + 2 oxidized plastocyanin =
CC       plastoquinone + 2 reduced plastocyanin.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 2Fe-2S cluster per subunit.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The 4 large subunits of the cytochrome b6-f complex are
CC       cytochrome b6, subunit IV (17 kDa polypeptide, petD), cytochrome f
CC       and the Rieske protein, while the 4 small subunits are petG, petL,
CC       petM and petN. The complex functions as a dimer (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Plastid, chloroplast thylakoid membrane;
CC       Single-pass membrane protein (By similarity). Note=The
CC       transmembrane helix obliquely spans the membrane in one monomer,
CC       and its extrinsic C-terminal domain is part of the other monomer
CC       (By similarity).
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: This protein is 1 of 2 subunits of the cytochrome
CC       b6-f complex that are encoded in the nucleus.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The Rieske iron-sulfur protein is a high potential
CC       2Fe-2S protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 Rieske domain.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

ID   US9_SUHVR               Reviewed;         106 AA.
AC   P11313;
DT   01-JUL-1989, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   01-JUL-1989, sequence version 1.
DT   02-MAR-2010, entry version 43.
DE   RecName: Full=Envelope protein US9 homolog;
DE   AltName: Full=11 kDa protein;
OS   Suid herpesvirus 1 (strain Rice) (SuHV-1) (Pseudorabies virus (strain
OS   Rice)).
OC   Viruses; dsDNA viruses, no RNA stage; Herpesvirales; Herpesviridae;
OC   Alphaherpesvirinae; Varicellovirus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=10350;
OH   NCBI_TaxID=9823; Sus scrofa (Pig).
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA].
RX   MEDLINE=87265472; PubMed=3037781; DOI=10.1016/0042-6822(87)90368-0;
RA   Petrovskis E.A., Post L.E.;
RT   "A small open reading frame in pseudorabies virus and implications for
RT   evolutionary relationships between herpesviruses.";
RL   Virology 159:193-195(1987).
RN   [2]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION, TOPOLOGY, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=9573219;
RA   Brideau A.D., Banfield B.W., Enquist L.W.;
RT   "The Us9 gene product of pseudorabies virus, an alphaherpesvirus, is a
RT   phosphorylated, tail-anchored type II membrane protein.";
RL   J. Virol. 72:4560-4570(1998).
RN   [3]
RP   FUNCTION, TOPOLOGY, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=19420087; DOI=10.1128/JVI.00598-09;
RA   Lyman M.G., Kemp C.D., Taylor M.P., Enquist L.W.;
RT   "Comparison of the pseudorabies virus Us9 protein with homologs from
RT   other veterinary and human alphaherpesviruses.";
RL   J. Virol. 83:6978-6986(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Essential for the anterograde spread of the infection
CC       throughout the host nervous system. Together with the gE/gI
CC       heterodimer, US9 is involved in the sorting and transport of viral
CC       structural components toward axon tips.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Virion membrane; Single-pass type II
CC       membrane protein. Host Golgi apparatus membrane; Single-pass type
CC       II membrane protein. Host smooth endoplasmic reticulum membrane;
CC       Single-pass type II membrane protein (By similarity). Host cell
CC       membrane; Single-pass type II membrane protein (Potential).
CC       Note=During virion morphogenesis, this protein probably
CC       accumulates in the endosomes and trans-Golgi where secondary
CC       envelopment occurs. It is probably transported to the cell surface
CC       from where it is endocytosed and directed to the trans-Golgi
CC       network (TGN), maybe through an interaction with PACS-1 sorting
CC       protein.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on serines within the acidic cluster
CC       (Potential). Phosphorylation determines whether endocytosed viral
CC       US9 traffics to the trans-Golgi network or recycles to the cell
CC       membrane (Potential).
CC   -!- PTM: Not N-glycosylated.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the alphaherpesvirinae envelope protein US9
CC       family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
